hero: You save lives. Now you can save the planet, along with tens of millions of dollars every month with the only washable, sustainable medical gown of its kind.
See how our revolutionary technology is transforming healthcare.
Currently in trial with some of the most respected medical facilities in the U.S.

heroCards.title: Your monthly savings
heroCards.description: Chart shows savings on your investment for last month

heroCards.name: Alexander Collins
heroCards.description: MEDU gowns have transformed my surgeries, offering top-notch protection and saving costs.

informacion.descripcion1: The Spanish flu pandemic led to the adoption of cotton surgical gowns, aimed at reducing disease transmission in medical environments.
1930s: Cotton surgical gowns become standard in operating rooms. Although not sterile, they represented a significant advance in infection protection.
informacion.descripcion2: 1940s: Sterilization of surgical gowns becomes common practice, improving the prevention of postoperative infections.

informacion.descripcion1: 1970s: Stricter regulations are implemented to prevent cross-contamination in operating rooms, based on AORN and NIOSH standards.
informacion.descripcion2: 1980s: Materials like polypropylene improved gown comfort, fluid resistance, and antimicrobial properties.

informacion.descripcion1: 1990s: Focus on improving breathability and comfort of surgical gowns, with lighter materials and reduced costs without compromising safety.
informacion.descripcion2: 2000s: Interest in reusable and eco-friendly disposable gowns grows, leading to advances in washing, sterilization, and biodegradable materials.

informacion.titulo: Early 20th Century: Introduction of Surgical Gowns
informacion.descripcion1: 2021: COVID-19 increases demand for PPE. MEDU introduces reusable Level 4 PPE gowns and coveralls that are highly protective and eco-friendly.

heading: Changing the fabric of medicine
for good.
timeline.subheading: The medical gowns used today were designed in the 1940s.

years.label: Introduction of Surgical Gowns
years.description: The Spanish flu pandemic led to the adoption of cotton surgical gowns, aimed at reducing disease transmission.

years.label: Development and Standards
years.description: Cotton surgical gowns become standard in operating rooms, improving infection protection.

years.label: Regulations and Safety Environment
years.description: Stricter regulations implemented for preventing cross-contamination in operating rooms.

years.label: Efficiency and Sustainability
years.description: Focus on improving breathability, comfort, and reducing costs of surgical gowns.

years.label: Pandemic Response and Future
years.description: COVID-19 led to the development of reusable PPE gowns with high protection levels and eco-friendly materials.

heading: What has changed in the past
80 years?
features.subheading: Nearly everything—except the desire to preserve the health and safety of patients and caregivers.
features.description: Created with a proprietary process that yields the highest levels of protection and sterility, Medu brings protective coverings into the 21st Century with reusable Level 4 gowns and coveralls that require no special laundering and prevent cross-contamination.

heading: Give your hospital
a
waste-ectomy.
wasteEctomy.description: Medical waste is a 5,000,000-ton, 935 billion-dollar problem, compromising public health and creating significant financial strain on healthcare systems. Medu’s innovative medical gowns and coveralls offer an unparalleled ability to increase savings, while dramatically reducing landfill waste. After all, the planet deserves a long, healthy life, too.

heading: Become a partner for
change
form.description: Join Medu in reducing waste. Tell us about your company, your capabilities, and your goals. Then connect with us to learn how to become a distribution partner.

messages.agreeRequired: Please agree to the privacy policy.
messages.failure: Failed to send the message, please try again.

heading: How it
works
howItWorks.subheading: Reducing the cost of protective gowns by up to 80% while ensuring health and safety may sound too good to be true. But it isn’t.
howItWorks.description: Our patent-pending, anti-viral, anti-bacterial fabric can be washed up to 50 times with conventional hospital system detergents and equipment without losing protective properties and prevents cross-contamination, enabling caregivers to dramatically reduce gown changes.

appDemo.description: Our app tracks the cleaning and life status of each Medu garment so you know the status and lifecycle stage.
list: Check number of washes in real time

headlines.heading: Making headlines.
headlines.description: Medu is making news, and it's easy to see why. As the first and only medical products of its kind, we've received attention and accolades the world over.

quote.text: 'MEDU is changing the world one gown at a time'
quote.author: — Hillary Clinton

headlines.readMore: Read our press coverage, case studies, blog, and more.

heading: Inventing a modern
medical miracle
medicalMiracle.description: Medu was born out of curiosity, passion, and necessity. During the COVID-19 pandemic, Medu Founder and CEO Tamara Chayo watched people in her community in Mexico City struggle to find adequate protection against pathogens. The biochemical engineer worked around the clock to address this urgent need and invented an innovative new fabric–and a social movement.
medicalMiracle.readMore: Read more about Medu’s origin and team.

heading: The difference that
makes a difference.
difference.description: Medu is not just the first of its kind. It’s the first of its kind offering a host of benefits to optimize savings of all kinds. See how Medu stacks up.

callToAction.heading: Change your gowns. Transform the world.
callToAction.description: Save money, time, and waste in a way never before possible. Reach out to book a meeting, learn more, and get started.

heading: Save
more
description: With Medu medical gowns, you save up to
over typical PPE coverings. You also save the planet from landfill-clogging medical waste and preserve valuable time that saves lives.

onlyMedical.description1: As the only medical gown that offers Level 4 protection with the ability to protect against cross-contamination, Medu gowns can be worn across multi patient visits, giving caregivers back time they would have spent changing.
onlyMedical.description2: And less time changing clothes means more time changing–and saving–lives.

heading: Protection
without compromise
protection.description1: Medu’s revolutionary fabric offers optimal protection and unparalleled comfort.
protection.description2: Developed by a biochemical engineer and in trial with some of the most prestigious medical facilities in the United States, Medu uses a patent-pending membrane that traps and kills viruses and bacteria, then washes them away with laundering that requires no special detergents or equipment.

description.protection: Optimized for protection and comfort, our surgical gown combines durability and flexibility, ideal for healthcare settings.

description.text: Designed for full-body protection, our coverall ensures safety and mobility in demanding environments.
Our comprehensive surgical packs provide sterilized garments for efficient and safe procedures. Ask about the different surgical packages.

subTitle: Take care of the planet and
each other

intro: Medu gowns are as easy to use as they are to love. They need no special detergents or laundry equipment, and can be washed 50+ times at 60°C (140° F).
To ensure accurate tracking of washings, Medu offers the Protect app.
descriptions.stepsIntro: Know the age and stage of your Medu gowns and coveralls in four easy steps:

steps.title: Step 1
steps.description: Download the Medu Protect app and register your e-mail to create an account.

steps.title: Step 2
steps.description: Scan your suits in a practical way, bring your device close to the suit to register the wash.

steps.title: Step 3
steps.description: View the life status of your suits, check the number of scanned washes in real time.

steps.title: Step 4
steps.description: Easily manage your suits and rate their quality after each wash.

title: Medu for
medical
hero.subtitle: Every level of protection for every type of care.
hero.description: Medu medical gowns and coveralls were purpose-made for the medical industry. Developed to safeguard healthcare providers and patients from exposure to infectious agents, bodily fluids, chemicals, and other hazards present in healthcare settings, only Medu offers anti-cross-contamination Level 4 protection in a reusable, sustainable fabric.

section1.paragraph1: Medu provides infection control across all caregiver-patient scenarios, including surgical suits and isolation units where sterile conditions are paramount. Because healthcare providers can wear each gown or coverall multiple times, Medu reduces the number of changes required, resulting in more time with patients–and greater potential to save lives.
section1.paragraph2: Medu’s comfortable, breathable, patent-pending material allows for up to 50 washings. Medical facilities and institutions don’t need to invest in specialized equipment, making Medu easy to incorporate into current systems. Learn how Medu gowns are tracked and laundered.

section2.statistic_text: With the ability for each medical/surgical gown to replace 450 gowns, Medu helps save more time, more lives, and more resources.

title: Medu for other
industries
section.description: With our revolutionary fabric, Medu isn’t just perfect for medicine. We also offer protection for a variety of other industries that require protection from contaminants. These industries include food and beverage, chemical, pharmaceutical, industrial, and more.

cards.title: Food and Beverage
cards.description: Medu is perfect for the food and beverage industry. Our fabric is designed to protect against contaminants, making it the perfect choice for food and beverage workers.

cards.title: Chemical Industry
cards.description: Chemical workers require protection from harmful substances. Medu’s fabric is specifically designed to protect against contaminants in chemical environments.

cards.title: Pharmaceutical Industry
cards.description: The pharmaceutical sector demands protection from contaminants. Medu’s fabric offers the necessary protection against hazardous substances, ensuring safety.

cards.title: Industrial Use
cards.description: Medu’s gowns are used in automotive and other industries, offering protection from chemical hazards and compliance with safety regulations, while being easy to launder.

ready.title: Ready to see how we’re changing the fabric of medicine?
ready.description: Trial it in your institution or facility.

title: The people behind the
movement
hero.description: At Medu, our team of dedicated professionals is at the forefront of innovation in personal protective equipment. Starting from humble beginnings in a school laboratory, our collective expertise has pioneered the development of a membrane that chemically encapsulates pathogens, significantly reducing the risk of cross-contamination. Today, Medu represents a movement of safety and innovation, driven by a team committed to making a difference in public health. Meet the Medu team, leaders in creating protective solutions that save lives.

title: Medu was born and a movement
was created
team.subtitle: Meet Tamara and the rest of the Medu team.

members.name: Tamara Chayo Romo
members.description: Tamara, a Thiel Fellow and Halcyon Fellow, has raised over 4 million dollars for MEDU since 2020. Committed to sustainability, she mentors and supports young entrepreneurs while continuing to impact the medical fabric industry.

members.name: Alberto Yarza
members.description: Alberto has spent over 12 years optimizing operations across various sectors, including marketing and retail. Passionate about food and water sports, he has lived in three countries and worked with multiple foundations.

members.name: Roberto Ayala
members.description: Roberto is a chemical engineer with experience in quality audits and manuals. A graduate of Universidad La Salle, he is currently pursuing a Master's degree in Administration while leading Medu's operations.

members.name: Jorge Rosas
members.description: Jorge, Medu's first employee, holds a degree in business administration. He is committed to helping Medu break barriers globally and is also a successful content creator, known for building strong relationships.

members.name: David Zayas
members.description: David holds an MBA and specializes in business development across North America. With experience in healthcare, food, and Proptech, he leads Medu’s expansion efforts, focusing on sustainable solutions for multiple industries.

members.name: Adriana Ávila
members.description: Adriana, an Environmental Sciences graduate, implements safety, hygiene, and quality processes to ensure manufacturing excellence at Medu. She specializes in the application of STPS-issued NOMs for workplace safety.

members.name: Sophia Chayo
members.description: Sophia, recognized for her academic excellence, is an expert in human resources. She plays a key role in keeping the Medu team running smoothly and ensuring a strong, cohesive working environment.

members.name: Adrian Rosas
members.description: Adrian, a Fashion Design student and DJ, specializes in cold calling and sales at MEDU. His multidisciplinary skills help Medu expand into the healthcare and food industries with sustainable solutions.

members.name: Saman Mortazavi
members.description: Saman, with experience in startups and Unicorn companies like Deel and Rappi, helps scale businesses quickly. He is passionate about food, sports, and traveling, contributing to Medu's go-to-market strategies.

title: Meet us
in person
description: You’ve gotten to know who we are and why we started Medu.
Reach out to book a meeting.

title: Contact us to take the
first step.
first.description: Save money, time, and waste in a way never before possible. Reach out to book a meeting, learn more, and get started.
